title: One Direction concert forces British hockey team to postpone game
text:
One Direction concert forces British hockey team to postpone game Resize Text Comments 0 By Michael Smith October 22 at 7:53 PM Members of the pop group One Direction pose for photographers at the Capital Summertime Ball at Wembley Stadium in London in June. (Neil Hall/Reuters) 
A professional hockey team in the United Kingdom’s Elite Ice Hockey League wasn’t particularly thrilled to learn the reason why its Friday matchup against a team in Belfast, Ireland, was postponed this week. The Sheffield Steelers were scheduled to play the Stena Line Belfast Giants, but instead, English-Irish boy band One Direction will be singing at SSE Arena in Belfast. 
The band was scheduled to perform at the arena Tuesday, but band member Liam Payne became ill , which forced the show to be moved to Friday, bumping the hockey game. A makeup date for the game has not yet been announced, the Giants said in a statement. Steelers statement on the postponed game this Friday https://t.co/MAjPFgDWP9 pic.twitter.com/bXDTP2weXm 
— STEELERS OFFICIAL (@steelershockey) October 21, 2015 
Shaun Smith, the Steelers’ operations director, said : “We are disappointed that the game isn’t proceeding not only for ourselves but for the many fans who have already booked their travel, hotel and game night tickets.” Steelers owner Tony Smith added : “This is unacceptable and not the end of the matter.” 
The Giants said in their own statement that fans who bought tickets for Friday’s game will be given tickets for the game when it is finally played. 
SSE Arena General Manager Neil Walker said: “We are extremely grateful to the Belfast Giants and Sheffield teams and apologise to their fans for the inconvenience caused.” 
The Steelers will play the Giants on Saturday in a game that was already scheduled.
